target_audience.primary_persona: Software developers building and maintaining the CurryDash food delivery platform (Laravel backend and Flutter frontend developers)
secondary_personas: Food vendors and restaurant owners using the Seller Portal
Platform administrators managing the CurryDash system
DevOps engineers handling deployment and infrastructure
pain_points: Difficulty keeping docs in sync with rapidly evolving codebase
Lack of centralized knowledge base for multi-team collaboration
Manual documentation updates are error-prone and time-consuming
Different audiences need different levels of technical detail
goals: Quickly understand the CurryDash platform architecture
Find accurate API documentation for integration work
Learn how to use the Seller Portal effectively
Keep documentation automatically synchronized with code changes
target_audience.usage_context: Accessed during development, onboarding, troubleshooting, and integration work. Used by developers daily for API reference, by vendors for portal guidance, and by admins for platform management instructions.

product_vision.one_liner: A centralized, automatically-synchronized documentation platform for the CurryDash Sri Lankan food delivery service ecosystem.
product_vision.problem_statement: CurryDash operates across multiple repositories (Laravel backend, Flutter apps) with different audiences (developers, vendors, admins). Without centralized documentation, knowledge becomes fragmented, onboarding is slow, and keeping docs current with code changes requires significant manual effort.
product_vision.value_proposition: CurryDash Docs provides a single source of truth that automatically stays in sync with code repositories using BMAD Method workflows and semantic versioning. It delivers audience-specific content (developers, vendors, admins) through a modern, searchable Nextra-powered documentation site with a headless API for integration.
success_metrics: Documentation coverage of all major features across both repositories
Reduced time-to-productivity for new team members (<1 week onboarding)
Documentation freshness (auto-sync latency <24 hours after code merge)
Search effectiveness (Pagefind index covers all content)
API documentation completeness for all REST endpoints
Positive feedback from all three audience segments

existing_features: Nextra 4 documentation site with Next.js 16 App Router
Multi-audience content structure (developers, vendors, admins, API reference)
Cross-repository sync workflows via GitHub Actions
BMAD Method integration for documentation generation
Headless API endpoints for navigation and content delivery
MDX content support with React components
95+ MDX documentation files covering platform topics
Change spec system for tracking documentation updates
known_gaps: Documentation content needs enrichment with more examples and code samples
API reference documentation may be incomplete for all endpoints
Versioned documentation (multiple versions) not yet supported
Analytics and usage tracking not implemented
PDF export or offline documentation not available
Video tutorials and interactive guides not created
technical_debt: Legacy docs in docs-legacy/ need migration/consolidation
Documentation sync workflow may need testing with actual code repository triggers
Some placeholder content may exist in audience-specific sections

differentiators: Automatic sync with multiple source code repositories via BMAD Method
Multi-audience architecture with role-specific content paths
Headless API enabling documentation-as-a-service for other applications
Semantic versioning tied to documentation changes
Deep integration with existing CI/CD and development workflows
competitive_context.market_position: Internal documentation platform purpose-built for the CurryDash multi-repository architecture. Prioritizes automation, developer experience, and audience-specific content delivery over general-purpose documentation features.

technical: Documentation must support Next.js App Router patterns
Content format locked to MDX for Nextra compatibility
Styling constrained to Tailwind CSS and Nextra theme
resources: Single repository with initial commit indicates early-stage project
Documentation updates depend on development team discipline with commit conventions
BMAD workflow execution requires manual triggering by developers
dependencies: GitHub Actions for CI/CD and cross-repository sync
CurryDash-Admin-Seller-Portal repository for backend documentation triggers
CurryDash-UserApp-Mobile_Web-Flutter repository for frontend documentation triggers
GitHub Personal Access Token for repository dispatch
